conclusion: Initial conditions of car and truck speeds and initial distance.
Car's velocity decreases linearly from 30 m/s to 10 m/s over 4 seconds; truck's velocity remains constant at 10 m/s.
Calculate car's average velocity over 4 seconds as 20 m/s.
Calculate distance traveled by the car in 4 seconds as 80 meters.
Calculate distance traveled by the truck in 4 seconds as 40 meters.
Calculate relative distance between car and truck after 4 seconds as 10 meters.
Determine that the car is 10 meters ahead of the truck and speeds match, so they will not collide.
